title: Health threat of global plastics projected to soar, researchers warn
desc: The threat posed by plastic production, usage and disposal to human health will skyrocket in the coming years unless the world does something to address this global crisis, researchers warned on Monday, January 26. A British-French team of researchers attempted to cover all the different ways that plastic affects health during its lifecycle, from oil and gas extraction during production to all the products that end up in landfills. title: Bank Windhoek first to accept deposits of new banknotes
desc: %%title%% %%sep%% %%primary_category%% %%sep%% %%sitename%% %%sep%% Bank Windhoek has become the first bank in Namibia to upgrade its ATMs to accept deposits of the new Namibia Dollar banknotes.

title: Eight historical exhibits at Rétromobile commemorate 125 years of Škoda Motorsport
desc: Mladá Boleslav/Paris, 29 January 2023 – Škoda Auto is kicking off this year’s celebrations marking 125 years of Škoda Motorsport at one of the world’s most prestigious historic car exhibitions. Together with Škoda France, the Mladá Boleslav-based carmaker has prepared an attractive presentation for the Rétromobile exhibition, featuring eight exhibits from the Škoda Museum. They highlight key moments from the brand’s racing history – from early successes on two wheels to modern rally specials.

title: UAE’s $115 Billion Lunate Taps ADQ Boss In Quest to Double Size
desc: The chief executive officer of Abu Dhabi’s $263 billion wealth fund ADQ is stepping down to take on a new role at Lunate, the region’s largest alternatives manager that’s seeking to more than double assets over the next five years.

title: Influencer fined RM40,000 over offensive video of homeless man
desc: KUANTAN: A social media influencer was fined RM40,000 on Thursday (Jan 29) after he pleaded guilty to posting an offensive video on social media showing three teenage boys giving rice mixed with chicken bones to a homeless man on a sidewalk.

title: Lawmaker Urges Soludo to Reconsider Onitsha Market Closure
desc: A lawmaker urges Governor Soludo to rethink the Onitsha market closure, citing massive economic losses and calling for dialogue with market leaders.

title: Economic crisis forces Health Department to cut anti-polio campaign duration and slash payments to polio workers in Rawalpindi
desc: Major reductions have also been made to workers' facilities, sparking concerns that the anti-polio drive could be severely impacted. Polio workers, upset over the pay cuts, have staged protests and warned of further demonstrations. Assertions by the district administration regarding the eradication of polio in Rawalpindi have also been proven inaccurate. The next anti-polio campaign in Rawalpindi district is scheduled to start on February 2 and will run from Monday, February 2, to Thursday, February 5, TET reported.
